title: Standardised packaging could save up to 0.8 million tonnes of plastic waste
summary: A new report by Biffa proposes reducing plastic packaging waste in the UK. The report highlights opportunities such as standardising packaging materials, extending the Plastic Packaging Tax, and investing in non-mechanical recycling technologies. A multipronged approach including legislation, education, and investment is needed to achieve a more circular economy.

title: How Tata Steel is leading sustainability in the steel sector
summary: Tata Steel is a leader in sustainability, with a focus on reducing carbon footprint, water consumption, air pollution, and solid waste. The company has implemented various green innovations, business innovations, green products, and green processes to achieve its sustainability goals. Tata Steel has received global recognition for its sustainability efforts, including being recognized as a Steel Sustainability Champion by worldsteel for seven consecutive years.
green_innovation: TRUE, Tata Steel has implemented various green innovations to reduce its environmental impact, such as using dry processes for reduction, implementing new technologies to reduce dust emissions, and developing a technology to convert hazardous sludge into value-added pellets.
business_innovation: TRUE, Tata Steel has implemented various business innovations to improve its efficiency and reduce its environmental impact, such as establishing an Electric Arc Furnace (EAF) based long products steel plant to maximize the use of steel scrap and partnering with Tata Power Renewable Energy Ltd to establish renewable power capacity.
green_product: TRUE, Tata Steel has developed eco-friendly light construction products such as green paver blocks and interlocking blocks, which are manufactured using iron and steel slags.
green_process: TRUE, Tata Steel has developed a patented sustainable waste management technology for utilizing Basic Oxygen Furnace slag to manufacture a sulphur-rich nutrient supplement branded ‘Dhurvi Gold’ and a technology to convert hazardous sludge of steel plant into value-added pellets.

title: Food Cycle Science Secures Strategic Investment from Power Sustainable Lios to Accelerate Growth
summary: Power Sustainable Lios has invested in Food Cycle Science, a company that provides innovative solutions for managing food waste. Food Cycle Science's flagship product is the FoodCycler, an electric food waste recycler that transforms food scraps into a dry, odorless byproduct, avoiding methane emissions from landfills. The company's technology and business model position it as a clear leader in the growing market for sustainable waste management solutions.
green_innovation: TRUE - The FoodCycler reduces methane emissions from landfills by transforming food scraps into a dry, odorless byproduct.
business_innovation: TRUE - The FoodCycler is a new and improved product that differs significantly from previous food waste management methods and has been introduced to the market.
green_product: TRUE - The FoodCycler is a good that is designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE - The FoodCycler uses energy-efficient technology to process food waste in homes in a manner that eliminates odors and reduces volume by up to 90%.

greenwashing: FALSE - The FoodCycler is not an example of greenwashing as it provides genuine environmental benefits by reducing methane emissions from landfills.
